title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 November 2012 - XWiki
content:
<mflorea> has quit  
01:01 <jvdrean> has quit  
02:15 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
02:17 <Chuguniy> Hi, I got this problem configuring XWiki on CentOS 5.8. When I try to register a new user catalina.out.log writes this http://pastebin.com/F65cjvhc As far as I can tell there is something wrong with DB connection, maybe DB driver. Any thoughts? Thank you.  
02:37 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
02:46 <Chuguniy> has quit  
02:46 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
03:02 <Chuguniy> has quit  
03:30 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
03:33 <sburjan`> has quit  
03:33 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
06:07 <tekzilla> has quit  
06:09 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
06:55 <vmassol> has quit  
07:36 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
07:49 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:59 <jvelo> has quit  
07:59 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:44 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
09:36 <SvenDowideit\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <SvenDowideit\_> is now known as <SvenDowideit>  
09:38 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <Enygma`> vmassol: I thought we had agreed on things like this https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b346e7ff0f5fd7b121aaa983d69e0c53aa35c09f and this https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/4303f79df9c0ef657a8f8f823fb76aff3f9a1f99  
10:19 <vmassol> yes we agreed on them which is why I committed the move ;)  
10:19 <Enygma`> to \*at least\* mention the source of the files, when moving from one repo to another  
10:19 <Enygma`> you`ve just broken history  
10:20 <vmassol> we agreed to not move history  
10:20 <vmassol> (at least that's what I recall)  
10:20 <Enygma`> that`s not what I`ve just said  
10:20 <vmassol> no it's not broken  
10:20 <vmassol> it's still there  
10:20 <vmassol> it only depends on your UI  
10:20 <vmassol> as to whether you follow renames or not  
10:20 <Enygma`> we were not agreeing what to do with history, but, as an intermediate solution, we agreed to include in the commit message the source repo and the parent commit  
10:20 <vmassol> I have moved, not deleted and recreated  
10:20 <vmassol> so history is not lost  
10:21 <Enygma`> so that we have a way of tracing back the history from repo to repo  
10:21 <vmassol> btw it's all recorded in jira too  
10:21 <vmassol> in the commit tab  
10:21 <vmassol> unfortunately  
10:21 <vmassol> it's too late to change the commit message  
10:21 <vmassol> it's already pushed  
10:21 <Enygma`> you can revert  
10:22 <vmassol> that would make history even harder to follow  
10:22 <Enygma`> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8438?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin:bitbucket-commits-tabpanel is empty (not working)  
10:22 <evalica> the jira commit tab … that is usually broken … and don't display anything  
10:22 <vmassol> jira comimt tab works perfectly well  
10:22 <evalica> not true  
10:22 <vmassol> evalica: it's been working 100% well for ages  
10:23 <Enygma`> generally yes, it works, but occasionally you don`t see some commits  
10:23 <vmassol> (since I fixed it)  
10:23 <Enygma`> just look at the jira link I just gave you  
10:23 <vmassol> right now it's just that the scan has not been done I guess  
10:23 <Enygma`> ok, let`s assume that  
10:23 <vmassol> you can check here: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/admin/ConfigureBitbucketRepositories!default.jspa  
10:23 <evalica> anyway I think we have a standard when we close an issue that at least we mention the commit where we did the change  
10:23 <vmassol> " last commit 16 hours ago"  
10:23 <Enygma`> but that still does not specify the parent project in the xwiki-enterprise git project  
10:24 <vmassol> so it hasn't rechecked yet  
10:24 <vmassol> "anyway I think we have a standard when we close an issue that at least we mention the commit where we did the change" no  
10:24 <vmassol> point me to the practice  
10:24 <vmassol> that's useless  
10:24 <evalica> ….. so in your opinion.. we need to put affects, we need to put components … and all the fields for JIRA, but we DON'T have to write a closing message, right?  
10:24 <vmassol> it's ALREADY there  
10:25 <vmassol> that's why we have the commit tab  
10:25 <Enygma`> what is already there?  
10:25 <Enygma`> ah, you mean you`ve used the same jira issue for both platform and enterprise?  
10:25 <vmassol> yes  
10:25 <Enygma`> and it shows in the commit tab both repos  
10:25 <vmassol> yes  
10:25 <evalica> there are so many times …. when that tab didn't worked and I had to search the logs and waist to much time …  
10:26 <vmassol> it just works  
10:26 <vmassol> all the time  
10:26 <vmassol> it iddn't before when we were using the older way of doing it  
10:26 <vmassol> since I changed to the DVCS plugin it's been working all the time  
10:27 <vmassol> at least I've never seen anyone mentioning it's not working and it has alwasy worked for me since then  
10:27 <vmassol> in any case there's certainly no practice to put a commit rev in jira  
10:27 <vmassol> (manually I mean)  
10:27 <vmassol> make a proposal if you think that's worth it and we can vote on it  
10:30 <vmassol> sorry evalica, i don't have time to show you hwo to get your history but it's not lost, don't worry, it's still there  
10:30 <vmassol> and it's counted in all our stats too  
10:30 <vmassol> I have to go drive to devoxx in a few seconds/minutes  
10:32 <vmassol> (just in case you see me disconnect suddenly ;))  
10:33 <vmassol> (waiting for my pick up to arrive)  
10:36 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <Enygma`> vmassol: http://markmail.org/message/wxsqvbxka3jmmfnd Did you get to do that?  
10:37 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <vmassol> Enygma`: unfortunately no  
10:40 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <Enygma`> so the only backup we are using right now is hoping that the developer uses the same Jira issue for both repositories in the commit message, since we don`t have a clear practice on that. (sometimes we make 1, sometimes we make 2 issues - one for each project/repo)  
10:42 <vmassol> well as I said nothing is lost  
10:42 <vmassol> so you can find it again in git  
10:42 <Enygma`> yes, it`s just a pain to dig for it, instead of using the existing tools  
10:42 <vmassol> yes it's a pain  
10:43 <vmassol> git is a pain  
10:43 <vmassol> (in this regards)  
10:43 <Enygma`> so we should at least establish this as a practice when moving stuff around  
10:43 <vmassol> which part?  
10:43 <vmassol> the commit message?  
10:43 <vmassol> I agree about it, I just didn't remember it  
10:44 <vmassol> I've put the info in jira for now  
10:44 <Enygma`> using the same jira issue (coresponding to the target jira project) for both source and target git repo  
10:44 <vmassol> (even though it should appear in the commit tab)  
10:48 <vmassol> Enygma`: correction, you won't see both commits in the commits tab for a given jira issue  
10:48 <vmassol> because a jira project is mapped to git repo  
10:48 <vmassol> (1-1 relationship)  
10:48 <vmassol> just checked  
10:49 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8437?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin:bitbucket-commits-tabpanel  
10:49 <vmassol> sorry got to go  
10:49 <vmassol> we can talk later and finish the discussion thread  
10:50 <vmassol> has quit  
12:36 <mflorea> has quit  
12:48 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
12:49 <jvdrean> has quit  
13:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <larian> has joined #xwiki  
14:31 <benkertp> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <larian> has quit  
14:39 <benkertp> Hi all, is there a way to filter the activity stream to only show messages (Milestone 4.2)  
14:45 <Enygma`> benkertp: there is a jira for that http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6698 and I also did a patch for it. It just needs to be reviewed and applied. Will probably happen soon, like 4.4-milestone-1, since it`s quite late to include that in 4.3  
14:50 <benkertp> ok, thank you - then I need to think about another solution  
14:53 <Enygma`> benkertp: you can try applying the pull request yourself. Here's the code: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/pull/27/files and the translations https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/55/files  
14:56 <benkertp> Enygma`: thanks, I have a look at it  
14:57 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki
